channel.title: BBC: Recently added blogs and sub-categories at ooh.directory
channel.description: The blogs and sub-categories added to the BBC category at ooh.directory most recently

item.title: feeling listless
item.description:
“"Poverty of goods is easily cured; poverty of the mind is irreparable.".”
By Stuart Ian Burns.
🇬🇧 Started in 2001.
Average 489 words.
item.content:encoded:
“"Poverty of goods is easily cured; poverty of the mind is irreparable.".” By Stuart Ian Burns.

🇬🇧 Started in 2001. Average 489 words.

item.title: BBC Writersroom - BBC Blogs
item.description:
“Get behind-the-scenes insights from writers and producers of BBC TV and radio programmes. Get top tips on script-writing and follow the journeys of writers who have come through BBC Writersroom schemes and opportunities.”
🇬🇧 Started in 2007.
Average 1,321 words.
item.content:encoded:
“Get behind-the-scenes insights from writers and producers of BBC TV and radio programmes. Get top tips on script-writing and follow the journeys of writers who have come through BBC Writersroom schemes and opportunities.”

🇬🇧 Started in 2007. Average 1,321 words.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing - BBC Blogs
item.description:

item.title: Media Action Insight Blog - BBC Blogs
item.description:
“Media Action Insight aims to inform policy, research and practice on the role of media around BBC Media Action's priority themes of governance and rights, health, resilience and humanitarian response. It is a space for our staff and guest bloggers to share analysis, insight and research findings.”
🇬🇧 Started in 2016.
Average 1,251 words.
item.content:encoded:
“Media Action Insight aims to inform policy, research and practice on the role of media around BBC Media Action's priority themes of governance and rights, health, resilience and humanitarian response. It is a space for our staff and guest bloggers to share analysis, insight and research findings.”

🇬🇧 Started in 2016. Average 1,251 words.

item.title: BBC History Research Blog - BBC Blogs
item.description:
“Every year the BBC opens its archives to a wide range of academics researching the BBC’s role in national and international history. Their research leads to bestselling books, academic papers and in-depth journalistic articles.”
🇬🇧 Started in 2018.
